Riot your North American servers obviously can't handle the amount of log-ins and haven't been able to for some time. There are constant lag spikes or game crashes and always at the worst time, a team fight or under a tower, or something. When you did move the servers, why you didn't move somewhere like Chicago I guess we'll never know, but that's in the past now. However, to fix the future of League please build an East Coast server. You seem to find plenty of time to design new champion skins, clothing, and toys so, please find time to fix the actual game, thank you.

They are working on it. As stated in their pinned posts they are working on a server road map to reduce the stress on the servers. And it's not like riot can drag skin designers to do coding. It doesn't work like that

I'm with you on this but to be fair, Riot has had **3 years** to do this. Lag was a major problem by last year.

When I saw that video on pros playing with lag, that was a pitiful lag compared to what we face. I want to see some pros face "disconnects", lag spikes that last 10 seconds, game crashes that make them have to reconnect, and the worst thing ever is a disconnect that does not allow you to reconnect after 3 or more times.

You are absolutely correct sir.
They have been working **Tirelessly** for **3 years** on a system they want to last **over 20 years**.Riot have given us plenty of updates on it but they are literally building a network that will span all of NA that will reduce lag everywhere nearly permanently. These things aren't done overnight, in fact had they finished it last year I would be a skeptic of their entire system and it would ultimately fail do to under sight. I would be surprised if they have it finished before the end of this financial year.

DOTA2 and HOTS had amazing serves out the gate. They were, after all, made by extremely wealthy companies. Riot is having to build a network ENTIRELY FROM SCRATCH on a game that has already been released, and those things take time - you can't just throw money at things to make them work. 

 It wasn't until late season 2 that they really got the ball rolling on finances, and you can't get complicated server architecture running efficiently, not the scale that they want, in 2 and a half years.

It would be a shame to think a gaming company would have to work tirelessly at a game that is free and already out there. 

Yes, with constant updates (such as new champions, items, and modes) champions and other things in the game will need tweaks to make them fair with the games core focus. 

On the other hand, Riot has said, longer than the recent post update on new servers, that they would be trying to put out another for those on the Eastern part of NA. Though, when it came to be known that all they did was make another no where near the center of the NA, many grew angry because they felt let down. 

Lag was the main issue ever since I first got onto the Boards. It was always there and it never grew out. 

When I see a new skin, I think, "wow, that's cool" unless its a 750 skin that has a set with some others (I still find it cool but sad to see its not like how Riot use to do it, like the Pool Party skins). Riot already has at least 200â€“300 skins on the market. They also have rare skins that few are able to get and more that people are able to buy. 

If Riot were to be working tirelessly, I would had seen way more progress on Ao Shin after 3 years of waiting. You can't be working hard when you aren't working on everything and leave it for another (better) time.

I also know that they will not put out all these servers in a year. It's way to hard as just doing 1 should take almost a month with tests and such. It's just a mystery why they put *making more servers for those farther away* off for so long.

I'm kinda tempted to learn more about networking and such just so I can better understand their situation and mine so I can just be like "ok, I'm experiencing <insert type of lag> and clearly to my knowledge, I know it is not my net because such and such and such checks out, so it must be their servers because of this, this, and this." I always wanna rage so hard when I lag, but then 2 seconds later, I'm like, "maybe it was me who was lagging?" cause you ask that general "who's lagging?" question to others and they say they aren't, but you never know if it's still server side or not; or at least I don't.

I've been playing LoL since before there was a ranked season and I never had issue with lag, so my really noobish opinion when I get lag or anything is that LoL's servers are unable to handle the massive following the game has. Then I get angry at how large the community is. :< I just want better gameplay, LoL. I'll throw money at you, I'll buy skins or just moneygram you money so you don't have to focus so heavily on creating content for people to spend money on if you take a month or two, or three and just focus on fixing your servers.

Just wish one of the employees could give us a no-bs, completely true comment about how LoL is truly dealing with the internal struggle with their servers.

Hi guys.
                 Recently, the last three games I've played (Last night, and this morning) after Champion Select the client would disappear as if I'd go into a game. The same client reappears, and says the game crashed, with a nice little reconnect button on it. Of course, the obvious choice is to click reconnect, which is what I did. The same thing happened, it just made the client disappear then reappear. I probably kept on clicking reconnect for about 20 minutes, with nothing to gain from it. It didn't count as anything as a leave all three times. My first was a ranked, and then my second was a normal game and my third was a bots game because I got suspicious at that point. I'm not in low priority queues... During the first, the ranked game, I tried re-logging. and reconnecting a few times and it didn't work. During the normal match I repaired the client, still didn't work, and during the AI game I literally un-installed the whole game and re-installed which still didn't work. I'm in Canada so NA, and I'm wondering if this is a localized problem or does anyone else have this issue? Also, if anyone knows a possible fix to this issue that'd be great. I'm going to see if a custom game will connect now to see if that is the problem... 
                  Thanks

*Update: I tried a custom game and it didn't work either! I started, chose my champion, and then the next client that takes you into the game doesn't appear. Please help!
